WorkItem.Description:
Hi Folks,
Just ran into this exception when loading a map on Vista SP2:

A generic error occurred in GDI+.
   at System.Drawing.Graphics.CheckErrorStatus(Int32 status)
   at System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawImage(Image image, Single x, Single y, Single width, Single height)
   at GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapControl.DrawMap(Graphics g) in ...GMap.NET.WindowsForms\GMap.NET.WindowsForms\GMapControl.cs:line 545
   at GMap.NET.WindowsForms.GMapControl.OnPaint(PaintEventArgs e) in ...GMap.NET.WindowsForms\GMap.NET.WindowsForms\GMapControl.cs:line 1302
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PaintWithErrorHandling(PaintEventArgs e, Int16 layer)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmPaint(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.UserControl.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)

Binaries tested fine on Server 2008 and Win7 64.
Googled this to death, but the possabilities seem endless. Any ideas on why the GDI+ error for DrawImage?

Thanks,

Jack
